intro: Campanula rhomboidalis var. uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It features upright stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
